    • Field Detail

      • ASCII_CHARS

        private static final char[] ASCII_CHARS
        The characters that can be used for converting the image into ASCII characters. These are stored in descending order of intensity.

      • source

        private final java.awt.image.BufferedImage source
        The source image that this ASCII image is made from. We keep a reference to it here so that we can resize the ASCII image later if we ever need to. (This is also incredibly expensive to load.)

      • cached

        private GString[] cached
        The array of strings which make up this image. Each string in the array corresponds to a row of characters in the ASCII image.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ASCIImage

        public ASCIImage(java.lang.Object parameters,
                 java.awt.image.BufferedImage source)
        Create a new ASCII image from given source image.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The Layout parameters to use for positioning this image.
        source - The image to use for creating this ASCII image.

    • Method Detail

      • resize

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage resize()
        Resize the source image to the width and height allocated by the layout. Each of the pixels in the returned image represent a single Glyph.
        Returns:
        An appropriately scaled image for the size of this component.

      • mapImageToGlyphs

        private void mapImageToGlyphs()

      • draw

        public void draw(GlyphBuffer buffer)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Renders the component within the bounds of that this component has been inflated to. A component which updates Glyphs within the bounds that have been allocated by the Layout can be sure that the characters will be updated appropriately; the behavior for a component which does not is undefined.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Component
        Parameters:
        buffer - An object on which a component can draw itself, and which makes certain guarantees about conforming to the bounds which are allocated by a Container's layout.
